de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.util
Class WorldFile

java.lang.Object
  de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.commons.vo.ValueObject
      de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.commons.vo.World
          de.hochschule.bremen.minerva.server.util.WorldFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class WorldFile
extends World

Represents a physical file that contains the data structure to describe a world with it's countries and country dependencies. It is possible to parse this file and store the information in the world value object attributes.

Version:
$Id: WorldFile.java 786 2010-07-05 22:59:22Z andre.koenig $
See Also:

Method Detail

parse

public void parse()
           throws WorldFileExtensionException,
                  WorldFileNotFoundException,
                  WorldFileParseException
Parses the world import file and pushs the data into the world value object attributes.

Throws:
WorldFileNotFoundException - If the given "*.world" file was not found.
WorldFileParseException - If the world import file is not "well-formed".
WorldFileExtensionException - If the file extension is wrong.
See Also:
World

createCountryDependencies

public void createCountryDependencies()
                               throws WorldFileNotFoundException,
                                      WorldFileExtensionException,
                                      WorldFileParseException
Uses the world import file internal mapping structure and ports this to the real world value objects.

IMPORTANT: Use this method after you've persisted the world before. After you've persisted the countries for example will have the generated ids from the persistence layer. Otherwise it is not possible to create the mapping.

NOTE: You have to store the world object after creating the country dependencies to instruct the persistence layer to store this country relations.
NOTE2: If the world import file wasn' extracted before, this method will call the parse method.

Throws:
WorldFileParseException - If the parse method fails.
WorldFileExtensionException - If the parse method fails.
WorldFileNotFoundException - If the parse method fails.
See Also:
parse()

moveAssets

public void moveAssets()
                throws WorldFileNotFoundException,
                       WorldFileExtensionException,
                       WorldFileParseException
Move the world assets to the defined directory.

If the world import file wasn't extracted before, this method will call the parse method.

Throws:
WorldFileParseException - If the parse method fails.
WorldFileExtensionException - If the parse method fails.
WorldFileNotFoundException - If the parse method fails.
See Also:
parse()

Parameters:

Throws:
WorldFileParseException - If the document is not well-formed.

extractCountries

private void extractCountries(org.w3c.dom.Element dataSource)
                       throws WorldFileParseException
Extracts the countries from the world import file. The countries will be pushed into the countries vector World#getCountries() The world import file has an own "country-country" relation mapping (the id's from the persistence layer differs from the id's in the world import file). Further the method will extract the country dependencies and add the correct continent to the country value object.

Parameters:
dataSource - The worlds import file root element
Throws:
WorldFileParseException - If the world import file has the wrong data structure.

validate

private void validate()
               throws WorldFileExtensionException
Common file validation. TODO: Use in the next release dtd or xml schema for xml validation.

Throws:
WorldFileExtensionException

validate

private void validate(org.w3c.dom.Element dataSource)
               throws WorldFileParseException
Checks if the data sources given data structure is valid. If it is not valid the method will raise the WorldFileParseException.

Throws:
WorldFileParseException - The world import file is not well-formed.
